doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: SriLankan Airlines Ltd. Airline Centre, Bandaranaike International Airport, Vs V. B. P. K. Weerasinghe, Commissioner General of Labour, Department of Labour, before Hon. Adithya Patabendige, J.
latest_doc_d.parties: SriLankan Airlines Ltd. Airline Centre, Bandaranaike International Airport, Vs V. B. P. K. Weerasinghe, Commissioner General of Labour, Department of Labour,
latest_doc_d.keywords: Writ of Certiorari, Writ of Prohibition, Compensation in lieu of reinstatement, Trade union action, Judicial review of arbitral awards.
latest_doc_d.legistation: Article 140 of the Constitution Section 4 (1) of the Industrial Disputes Act.
